t: Matthew 13
The Parable of the Sower
That*p same day Jesus went out of the house and sat by the lake.
Such large crowds gathered around him that he got into a boat and sat in it, while all the people stood on the shore.
Then he told them many things in parables, saying: “A*r farmer*r went*r out*r to*r sow*r his*r seed.*r
As*r he*r was*r scattering*r the*r seed,*r some*r fell*r along*r the*r path,*r and*r the*r birds*r came*r and*r ate*r it*r up.*r
Some*r fell*r on*r rocky*r places,*r where*r it*r did*r not*r have*r much*r soil.*r It*r sprang*r up*r quickly,*r because*r the*r soil*r was*r shallow.*r
But*r when*r the*r sun*r came*r up,*r the*r plants*r were*r scorched,*r and*r they*r withered*r because*r they*r had*r no*r root.*r
Other*r seed*r fell*r among*r thorns,*r which*r grew*r up*r and*r choked*r the*r plants.*r
Still*r other*r seed*r fell*r on*r good*r soil,*r where*r it*r produced*r a*r crop—a*r hundred,*r sixty*r or*r thirty*r times*r what*r was*r sown.*r
Whoever*r has*r ears,*r let*r them*r hear.”*r
The*p disciples came to him and asked, “Why do you speak to the people in parables?”
He*p replied, “Because*r the*r knowledge*r of*r the*r secrets*r of*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r has*r been*r given*r to*r you,*r but*r not*r to*r them.*r
Whoever*r has*r will*r be*r given*r more,*r and*r they*r will*r have*r an*r abundance.*r Whoever*r does*r not*r have,*r even*r what*r they*r have*r will*r be*r taken*r from*r them.*r
This*r is*r why*r I*r speak*r to*r them*r in*r parables:*r “Though*rpn seeing,*r they*r do*r not*r see;*r though*rld hearing,*r they*r do*r not*r hear*r or*r understand.*r
In*rp them*r is*r fulfilled*r the*r prophecy*r of*r Isaiah:*r “ ‘You*rpn will*r be*r ever*r hearing*r but*r never*r understanding;*r you*rld will*r be*r ever*r seeing*r but*r never*r perceiving.*r

For*rln this*r people’s*r heart*r has*r become*r calloused;*r they*rld hardly*r hear*r with*r their*r ears,*r and*rld they*r have*r closed*r their*r eyes.*r Otherwise*rln they*r might*r see*r with*r their*r eyes,*r hear*rld with*r their*r ears,*r understand*rld with*r their*r hearts*r and*rln turn,*r and*r I*r would*r heal*r them.’*r
But*rp blessed*r are*r your*r eyes*r because*r they*r see,*r and*r your*r ears*r because*r they*r hear.*r

For*r truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r many*r prophets*r and*r righteous*r people*r longed*r to*r see*r what*r you*r see*r but*r did*r not*r see*r it,*r and*r to*r hear*r what*r you*r hear*r but*r did*r not*r hear*r it.*r
“Listen*rp then*r to*r what*r the*r parable*r of*r the*r sower*r means:*r

When*r anyone*r hears*r the*r message*r about*r the*r kingdom*r and*r does*r not*r understand*r it,*r the*r evil*r one*r comes*r and*r snatches*r away*r what*r was*r sown*r in*r their*r heart.*r This*r is*r the*r seed*r sown*r along*r the*r path.*r
The*r seed*r falling*r on*r rocky*r ground*r refers*r to*r someone*r who*r hears*r the*r word*r and*r at*r once*r receives*r it*r with*r joy.*r
But*r since*r they*r have*r no*r root,*r they*r last*r only*r a*r short*r time.*r When*r trouble*r or*r persecution*r comes*r because*r of*r the*r word,*r they*r quickly*r fall*r away.*r

The*r seed*r falling*r among*r the*r thorns*r refers*r to*r someone*r who*r hears*r the*r word,*r but*r the*r worries*r of*r this*r life*r and*r the*r deceitfulness*r of*r wealth*r choke*r the*r word,*r making*r it*r unfruitful.*r

But*r the*r seed*r falling*r on*r good*r soil*r refers*r to*r someone*r who*r hears*r the*r word*r and*r understands*r it.*r This*r is*r the*r one*r who*r produces*r a*r crop,*r yielding*r a*r hundred,*r sixty*r or*r thirty*r times*r what*r was*r sown.”*r
The Parable of the Weeds
Jesus*p told them another parable: “The*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r is*r like*r a*r man*r who*r sowed*r good*r seed*r in*r his*r field.*r
But*r while*r everyone*r was*r sleeping,*r his*r enemy*r came*r and*r sowed*r weeds*r among*r the*r wheat,*r and*r went*r away.*r
When*r the*r wheat*r sprouted*r and*r formed*r heads,*r then*r the*r weeds*r also*r appeared.*r

Though*r it*r is*r the*r smallest*r of*r all*r seeds,*r yet*r when*r it*r grows,*r it*r is*r the*r largest*r of*r garden*r plants*r and*r becomes*r a*r tree,*r so*r that*r the*r birds*r come*r and*r perch*r in*r its*r branches.”*r

He*p told them still another parable: “The*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r is*r like*r yeast*r that*r a*r woman*r took*r and*r mixed*r into*r about*r sixty*r pounds*r of*r flour*r until*r it*r worked*r all*r through*r the*r dough.”*r
Jesus*p spoke all these things to the crowd in parables; he did not say anything to them without using a parable.
So was fulfilled what was spoken through the prophet: “I*pn will open my mouth in parables, I*ld will utter things hidden since the creation of the world.”
The Parable of the Weeds Explained
Then*p he left the crowd and went into the house. His disciples came to him and said, “Explain to us the parable of the weeds in the field.”
He*p answered, “The*r one*r who*r sowed*r the*r good*r seed*r is*r the*r Son*r of*r Man.*r
The*r field*r is*r the*r world,*r and*r the*r good*r seed*r stands*r for*r the*r people*r of*r the*r kingdom.*r The*r weeds*r are*r the*r people*r of*r the*r evil*r one,*r
and*r the*r enemy*r who*r sows*r them*r is*r the*r devil.*r The*r harvest*r is*r the*r end*r of*r the*r age,*r and*r the*r harvesters*r are*r angels.*r
“As*rp the*r weeds*r are*r pulled*r up*r and*r burned*r in*r the*r fire,*r so*r it*r will*r be*r at*r the*r end*r of*r the*r age.*r
The*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r send*r out*r his*r angels,*r and*r they*r will*r weed*r out*r of*r his*r kingdom*r everything*r that*r causes*r sin*r and*r all*r who*r do*r evil.*r
They*r will*r throw*r them*r into*r the*r blazing*r furnace,*r where*r there*r will*r be*r weeping*r and*r gnashing*r of*r teeth.*r

“Once*rp again,*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r is*r like*r a*r net*r that*r was*r let*r down*r into*r the*r lake*r and*r caught*r all*r kinds*r of*r fish.*r

A Prophet Without Honor
When*p Jesus had finished these parables, he moved on from there.
Coming to his hometown, he began teaching the people in their synagogue, and they were amazed. “Where did this man get this wisdom and these miraculous powers?” they asked.
“Isn’t this the carpenter’s son? Isn’t his mother’s name Mary, and aren’t his brothers James, Joseph, Simon and Judas?
Aren’t all his sisters with us? Where then did this man get all these things?”
And they took offense at him. But*p Jesus said to them, “A*r prophet*r is*r not*r without*r honor*r except*r in*r his*r own*r town*r and*r in*r his*r own*r home.”*r
